	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Look in the conf directory (under HERITRIX_HOME), there should be a file
ca=
lled heritrix.properties where you can set the level of logging on various
=
modules and general policy etc.
 
My guess is (given how much logging you a=
re getting) that you got a build
with some of the logging set too fine. I s=
eem to recall that HEAD had that
bug awhile back, but it got fixed, so I be=
live a fresh install from the
CruiseControl build should do the trick. Or y=
ou can just adjust those values
yourself.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message--=
---
From: list1dism [mailto:list1dism@...] 
Sent: 18. n=F3vember 2004=
 13:17
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Re: C=
ontrolling heritrix from the command prompt



Ok thanks about the tip
It's=
 pretty clear, I'll manage

I encountered another problem a while ago
It lo=
gs too much on the file heritrix_out.log (not the one in the /bin
directory=
), the one on the root directory that I have heritrix on.
How can I disable=
 that huge amount of logging? We're talking about 1.5G
in less than a minut=
e.

Thanks in advance
